title: Drawing, "Erminia and Vafrino Tending the Wounded Tancred after the Battle of Argento [Tancrède secouru par Herminie et Vafrin après le combat d'Argante]", 1720–30
medium: Red chalk on off-white laid paper
markings:
Verso: Stamp of J. Peoli [Lugt 2020]
Verso: Stamp of Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration [Lugt 457c]
inscribed:
Verso in graphite: numerical annotations
Verso in ink along edge of sheet: the initals J.F.R.
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: A wounded soldier lying on the ground is assisted by a man wearing a turban (left) and a woman (right). The group is situated in a landscape, under a tree.  At right a horse is shown and in the foreground at left, lies a discarded shield.   A circular border is suggested implying that this composition was envisioned as a tondo.  See Curatorial Notes field.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Erminia and Vafrino Tending the Wounded Tancred after the Battle of Argento [Tancrède secouru par Herminie et Vafrin après le combat d'Argante]", 1720–30.
1720–30. Red chalk on off-white laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-73-274.
